newsitem.title: GERMANY: N.Europe rapeseed price off, buyers lose interest.
newsitem.headline: N.Europe rapeseed price off, buyers lose interest.

text.p: Rapeseed prices in Northern Europe have fallen sharply in line with a weaker Chicago soybean complex and because of fading crusher interest in old crop seed, brokers said on Friday.
"Crushers are emptying stocks and British and French traders are also offering cheap rapeseed," one broker said.
"There have also been reports of Czech sales to Germany. More and more sellers compete for a shrinking market."

Buyers free Hamburg reduced their ideas for June old crop purchases by 10 marks to 480 marks a tonne while June rapeseed of British origin was offered at 460 marks fob, where 20-25 marks have to be added for freight.
Virtually ideal crop weather conditions were expected to weigh on rapeseed prices over the next few weeks.
Seed for the 1997 harvest is receiving enough rain and has shrugged off the effects of comparatively low May temperatures, weather reports showed.
New crop buyers free Hamburg offered a little changed 455 marks for August delivery while Baltic and North Sea buyers paid 450 marks fob for the new crop.
May buyers at points other than Hamburg were at 455-480 marks, down from 480-495 last week and from 502-510 marks a fortnight ago, with June at 480-482.50 (495-500) and August at 437-450 (440-455).
Eastern German farmers had sold sizeable parts of the 1997 harvest in prefixed contracts at 410-440 marks ex-farm, price office ZMP said in a weekly report.
August rapeseed futures on the Matif exchange last traded at 446 marks, off two from last night and down nine on the week.
Rape meal ex Hamburg mills was offered unchanged at 31.00-31.25 marks per 100 kg fob spot, with June at 30.75, first half July at 30.50 and August-October at 26.00.
Rape oil sellers were little changed on the week at 91.75 marks per 100 kg for June-July and 91.00 for August-October.
